67 102-32 Highest governance body’s role in sustainability reporting 
  
Sustainability is incorporated into the corporate strategy by means of a consolidated corporate 
governance structure that is integrated into our objectives. At Board of Directors level, the Executive 
Board and the ESG Committee assist the Board in fulfilling its oversight duties regarding sustainability, 
operations/systems, operational resilience, and related structures and processes. Every year the 
sustainability report and/or ESG Report is prepared by the ESG Executive Board and submitted for 
approval to the Disclosure Committee, the governance body that approves statements and assesses 
external positioning and sectoral guidelines directed to the relationship with the Investor of XP Inc. 
 
	
102-33 Communicating critical concerns 
  
XP Inc. strives to disclose material information concerning its business consistently, completely and 
fairly, in accordance with the requirements of the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC"), the 
National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations (the "NASDAQ") and applicable law. 
  
XP Inc. adopts the policy that all disclosures made by the Company to security holders, the investment 
community or the press (i) are accurate and complete, (ii) fairly present the financial condition and 
operating results and business of XP Inc. in all material respects, and (iii) are made in a timely manner as 
required by the SEC, NASDAQ and applicable law. XP Inc. has adopted a Disclosure Controls and 
Procedures Policy to ensure that the information required to be disclosed by the Company in reports 
filed with the SEC under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is recorded, processed, summarized and 
reported within the time period specified by the regulatory institution. 
  
All employees are expected to comply with the Disclosure Controls and Procedures Policy, and failure to 
do so subjects the employee to disciplinary action and may be grounds for dismissal. Employees are 
encouraged to report possible violations of this Policy to the Investor Relations Department or through 
the Confidential Reporting Channel.
